criticalpath

Class CriticalPathGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • criticalpath.CriticalPathGraph

  • public class CriticalPathGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the critical path network as a whole. Part of the model.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CriticalPathGraph()
      Creates a critical path graph with a start and end node of weight 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTask(Task task)
      Adds a task to the network.
      void deleteTask(Task task)
      Deletes a task from the network.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Task>> getCriticalPaths()
      Gets all the critical paths that are in the network.
      Task getEndTask()
      A specific version of getTask() that gets the end task.
      Task getStartTask()
      A specific version of getTask() that gets the start task.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getSuccessorTasks(Task task)
      Gets the successors of a task by iterating through all of the tasks in the network and checking its predecessors
      Task getTask(java.lang.String id)
      Gets a task by their id string.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks()
      Returns the tasks in the network.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CriticalPathGraph

        public CriticalPathGraph()
        Creates a critical path graph with a start and end node of weight 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getTasks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTasks()
        Returns the tasks in the network.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of all tasks in the network.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task task)
             throws DuplicateTaskException
        Adds a task to the network. If the task is a duplicate task, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to be added to the network
        Throws:
        DuplicateTaskException - Thrown if the task to be added shares an id with a task already in the graph.

      • deleteTask

        public void deleteTask(Task task)
                throws InvalidTaskDeleteException
        Deletes a task from the network. If the start/end nodes are attempted to be deleted then an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to be deleted from the network.
        Throws:
        InvalidTaskDeleteException - Thrown if the task to be deleted is the start or end task node which have to be kept.

      • getTask

        public Task getTask(java.lang.String id)
             throws TaskNotFoundException
        Gets a task by their id string.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the required task.
        Returns:
        The task that has the id given.
        Throws:
        TaskNotFoundException - Thrown if task to retrieve doesn't exist.

      • getStartTask

        public Task getStartTask()
        A specific version of getTask() that gets the start task. This doesn't throw an exception as getting the start task should never cause an exception and saves having to deal with exception from getting tasks if they are just the start task.
        Returns:
        The start task.

      • getEndTask

        public Task getEndTask()
        A specific version of getTask() that gets the end task. This doesn't throw an exception as getting the end task should never cause an exception and saves having to deal with exception from getting tasks if they are just the end task.
        Returns:
        The end task.

      • getSuccessorTasks

        public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getSuccessorTasks(Task task)
        Gets the successors of a task by iterating through all of the tasks in the network and checking its predecessors
        Parameters:
        task - The task get the successors of.
        Returns:
        A list of tasks that contain the task as a predecessor

      • getCriticalPaths

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Task>> getCriticalPaths()
        Gets all the critical paths that are in the network.
        Returns:
        A list of list of tasks that each represent a critical path.
